Created: 1 days, 8 hrs ago (2025-11-27 18:03:11 Friday November 28 2025)
Summarized time-range: 2025-11-27 17:42 until 2025-11-27 18:02
### **Core Tasks & Projects**
-   **Live Wallpaper Development**: Defined requirements for a new "I Ching Periodic Table" live wallpaper, specifying interactive mouse hover functionality to reveal hexagram summaries, a dark visual style with black/grey/white gradients, and a periodic table layout for the 64 hexagrams.
-   **Music Production Web App Evaluation**: Reviewed the "Womp Womp Factory" web application, examining its "Sonic Alchemist" dubstep bass generation, synth engine settings (Oscillator, Glide Time, LFO Rate, Filter Cutoff, Filter Resonance), and accompaniment options (Complexity, Beat, Hi-Hat). Monitored the production deployment status of the "clay-loves-the-womp-womp" project on Vercel, noting its "Ready" status.

### **Key Discussions & Decisions**
-   **Personal Communication**: Engaged in a real-time Snapchat conversation about a family member's shop catching fire, discussing the extent of the damage including the inside, electrical systems, and tools.

### **Documents & Code Reviewed**
-   **Automotive Maintenance Guide**:
    -   Reviewed the "Toyota 5VZ-FE Timing Belt System Service Guide" in NotebookLM, focusing on the critical 217 ft-lbs harmonic balancer bolt torque, the non-interference engine design, the use of thread-locking sealant, OEM parts (Aisin, Mitsuboshi), and the coolant system "burping" procedure.
    -   Examined the guide's structured repair procedures, technical data for fluids and torque specifications, and precautions for SRS airbags.
    -   **Resource:** [Toyota 5VZ-FE Timing Belt System Service Guide - NotebookLM]()
-   **Construction Business Software Platform**:
    -   Conducted a comprehensive review of the Structur platform, exploring its features for Preconstruction (Leads, Intake, Ballparks, Estimates, Proposals), Project Management (Projects Pipeline, Tasks, Schedules, Daily Logs, Submittals, Files), Financial Management (Invoices, Expenses, Subcontracts, Change Orders, Timesheets), and Company Operations (Checklists, Flowcharts, Scorecards, Quizzes, Forms, Documents).
    -   **Resource:** [Streamline Your Construction Business - Structur]()
    -   **Resource:** [Leads Pipeline Tool for Contractors | Structur]()
    -   **Resource:** [Intake Tool for Contractors | Structur]()
    -   **Resource:** [Estimates Tool for Contractors | Structur]()
    -   **Resource:** [Projects Pipeline Tool for Contractors | Structur]()

- Received Facebook notifications regarding Trevor Grundstrom's interest in an invited "Keller Williams" event and Matthew Pettersen's reaction to a "Happy Thanksgiving Matthew!" comment.

Created: 1 days, 9 hrs ago (2025-11-27 16:43:17 Thursday November 27 2025)
Summarized time-range: 2025-11-27 16:22 until 2025-11-27 16:42
### **Core Tasks & Projects**
-   **Developed and deployed an "I Ching Periodic Table" Lively Wallpaper:**
    *   Created the necessary directory structure for the new wallpaper at `c:\Users\clayb\AppData\Local\Packages\12030rocksdanister.LivelyWallpaper97hca09mmv6hy\LocalCache\Local\Lively Wallpaper\Library\wallpapers\periodic_table`.
    *   Populated ` and ` with metadata, including author, license, file details, and user customization options such as `bgColor` and `accentColor`.
    *   Implemented the JavaScript logic to define a data array of 64 hexagrams (Symbol, Name, Summary) using Unicode characters (U+4DC0 to U+4DFF) and to generate an 8x8 grid with hover event handling for interactive details.
    *   Confirmed the successful creation and appearance of the "I Ching Periodic Table" in the Lively Wallpaper library.

### **Key Discussions & Decisions**
-   Initiated the daily kickoff for the **Curve AI Solutions project**, acknowledging a substantial pipeline of work including assessments, analytics, dashboards, and AI orchestration.
-   Expressed intent to update and add new tasks to project management for the **Curve AI Solutions project**.
-   Decided to explore the **nano-banana model from OpenRouter** as an alternative due to difficulties with Google APIs.

### **Documents & Code Reviewed**
-   **AI Research Trends:** Reviewed search results on Perplexity AI concerning "latest research trends in technology and computer science in 2025," specifically focusing on advances in AI, foundation models, efficiency, and domain specialization.
    -   [What are the latest research trends in technology and computer science in 2025?]()
-   **Microsoft Foundry:** Explored Microsoft's AI platform, reviewing quick-start templates for AI chat, multi-modal content processing, code modernization with agents, customer success stories, and documentation on training and managing AI solutions.
    -   [Microsoft Foundry]()
    -   [Microsoft Foundry Documentation]()
-   **Toyota 5VZ-FE Timing Belt Service Guide:** Reviewed detailed instructions and video summaries within NotebookLM for maintaining and repairing the Toyota 3.4L V6 engine, with emphasis on timing belt replacement procedures, torque specifications, and the engine's non-interference design.
    -   [Toyota 5VZ-FE Timing Belt System Service Guide - NotebookLM]()
-   **Project Repositories & Deployments:**
    -   GitHub repository for `claybowl/velvet-willow-moodboard`.
    -   Local development instance of `Velvet Willow | AI Interior Design` on `localhost:3000`.
    -   The `Services` page for `The Velvet Willow` website.
    -   Vercel deployment overview for `clay-loves-the-womp-womp`.
        -   [Womp Womp Factory Application]()
        -   [Womp Womp Factory Vercel Deployment]()

### **Next Steps**
-   Update project management tasks, including new items, for the **Curve AI Solutions project**.
-   Further investigate the **nano-banana model from OpenRouter**.
-   Ping Linear (project management tool) to reflect updates regarding the **nano-banana model**.

### **Core Tasks & Projects**
*   **Implementing Agentic Memory**: Actively reviewed and refined Python code for an agentic memory system using Graphiti and FalkorDB. This included modifying the `add_new_memory` function to summarize conversations and add episode facts, and enhancing the `query` function to create and merge `Query` nodes in the graph database with detailed metadata (user query, SQL query, success status, error, timestamp, embeddings).
*   **Developing Memory Context Retrieval**: Worked on a `query` function designed to concurrently search user summaries, database facts, and similar queries to construct a comprehensive memory context for an agent.
*   **Testing Text-to-SQL Tool (QueryWeaver)**: Engaged in extensive testing and demonstration of the QueryWeaver tool, a Text-to-SQL interface for enterprise databases, by posing various natural language queries and analyzing its SQL generation and response capabilities.

### **Key Discussions & Decisions**
*   **Agentic Memory Structure**: Focused on structuring memory storage to include detailed metadata for queries, such as user input, generated SQL, execution success/failure, and timestamps, to ensure comprehensive logging and retrieval.
*   **Concurrent Memory Search Strategy**: Decided to implement concurrent searches for user summaries, database facts, and similar queries to efficiently build a holistic memory context.
*   **QueryWeaver Data Interaction Capabilities**: Confirmed QueryWeaver's ability to translate complex natural language requests into accurate SQL queries for CRM data, including task management and sales performance analysis.

### **Documents & Code Focused On**
*   **Python Code for Agentic Memory**:
    *   `add_new_memory` function: Reviewed logic for summarizing conversations and adding episodes to Graphiti.
    *   `query` function (for adding query nodes): Modified Cypher query to include `uuid`, `user_query`, `sql_query`, `success`, `error`, `timestamp`, and `embeddings`.
    *   `query` function (for memory context retrieval): Reviewed implementation of concurrent `search_user_summary`, `search_database_facts`, and `retrieve_similar_queries`.
*   **QueryWeaver Interactions (Text-to-SQL)**:
    *   **Monthly Task Report**: Generated SQL and reports for 'sales_repl' tasks in July and August 2025, including details on status, priority, and related entities.
    *   **High-Priority Task Identification**: Generated SQL to filter for high-priority tasks for 'sales_repl' in August 2025.
    *   **Task-Birthday Proximity Analysis**: Generated SQL to calculate days between task due dates and a specified birthday (August 2, 2025).
    *   **Sales Volume Analysis**: Generated a complex SQL query using CTEs to identify customers with the highest and lowest sales volumes and their associated account managers, producing a report for Pinnacle Finance (highest) and Global Solutions (lowest).

### **Next Steps**
*   Further refine the Python `query` functions for optimal performance and error handling within the agentic memory system.
*   Continue evaluating QueryWeaver's capabilities with more diverse and complex natural language queries to assess its robustness for enterprise applications.

### **Core Tasks & Projects**
*   **Implementing Agentic Memory**: Actively reviewed and refined Python code for an agentic memory system using Graphiti and FalkorDB. This included modifying the `add_new_memory` function to summarize conversations and add episode facts, and enhancing the `query` function to create and merge `Query` nodes in the graph database with detailed metadata (user query, SQL query, success status, error, timestamp, embeddings).
*   **Developing Memory Context Retrieval**: Worked on a `query` function designed to concurrently search user summaries, database facts, and similar queries to construct a comprehensive memory context for an agent.
*   **Testing Text-to-SQL Tool (QueryWeaver)**: Engaged in extensive testing and demonstration of the QueryWeaver tool, a Text-to-SQL interface for enterprise databases, by posing various natural language queries and analyzing its SQL generation and response capabilities.

### **Key Discussions & Decisions**
*   **Agentic Memory Structure**: Focused on structuring memory storage to include detailed metadata for queries, such as user input, generated SQL, execution success/failure, and timestamps, to ensure comprehensive logging and retrieval.
*   **Concurrent Memory Search Strategy**: Decided to implement concurrent searches for user summaries, database facts, and similar queries to efficiently build a holistic memory context.
*   **QueryWeaver Data Interaction Capabilities**: Confirmed QueryWeaver's ability to translate complex natural language requests into accurate SQL queries for CRM data, including task management and sales performance analysis.

### **Documents & Code Focused On**
*   **Python Code for Agentic Memory**:
    *   `add_new_memory` function: Reviewed logic for summarizing conversations and adding episodes to Graphiti.
    *   `query` function (for adding query nodes): Modified Cypher query to include `uuid`, `user_query`, `sql_query`, `success`, `error`, `timestamp`, and `embeddings`.
    *   `query` function (for memory context retrieval): Reviewed implementation of concurrent `search_user_summary`, `search_database_facts`, and `retrieve_similar_queries`.
*   **QueryWeaver Interactions (Text-to-SQL)**:
    *   **Monthly Task Report**: Generated SQL and reports for 'sales_repl' tasks in July and August 2025, including details on status, priority, and related entities.
    *   **High-Priority Task Identification**: Generated SQL to filter for high-priority tasks for 'sales_repl' in August 2025.
    *   **Task-Birthday Proximity Analysis**: Generated SQL to calculate days between task due dates and a specified birthday (August 2, 2025).
    *   **Sales Volume Analysis**: Generated a complex SQL query using CTEs to identify customers with the highest and lowest sales volumes and their associated account managers, producing a report for Pinnacle Finance (highest) and Global Solutions (lowest).

### **Next Steps**
*   Further refine the Python `query` functions for optimal performance and error handling within the agentic memory system.
*   Continue evaluating QueryWeaver's capabilities with more diverse and complex natural language queries to assess its robustness for enterprise applications.

Automated Summary: 
Created: 2 days, 22 hrs ago (2025-11-26 03:25:34 Wednesday November 26 2025)
Summarized time-range: 2025-11-26 03:05 until 2025-11-26 03:25
### **Core Tasks & Projects**
*   **Implementing Agentic Memory**: Actively reviewed and refined Python code for an agentic memory system using Graphiti and FalkorDB. This included modifying the `add_new_memory` function to summarize conversations and add episode facts, and enhancing the `query` function to create and merge `Query` nodes in the graph database with detailed metadata (user query, SQL query, success status, error, timestamp, embeddings).
*   **Developing Memory Context Retrieval**: Worked on a `query` function designed to concurrently search user summaries, database facts, and similar queries to construct a comprehensive memory context for an agent.
*   **Testing Text-to-SQL Tool (QueryWeaver)**: Engaged in extensive testing and demonstration of the QueryWeaver tool, a Text-to-SQL interface for enterprise databases, by posing various natural language queries and analyzing its SQL generation and response capabilities.

### **Key Discussions & Decisions**
*   **Agentic Memory Structure**: Focused on structuring memory storage to include detailed metadata for queries, such as user input, generated SQL, execution success/failure, and timestamps, to ensure comprehensive logging and retrieval.
*   **Concurrent Memory Search Strategy**: Decided to implement concurrent searches for user summaries, database facts, and similar queries to efficiently build a holistic memory context.
*   **QueryWeaver Data Interaction Capabilities**: Confirmed QueryWeaver's ability to translate complex natural language requests into accurate SQL queries for CRM data, including task management and sales performance analysis.

### **Documents & Code Focused On**
*   **Python Code for Agentic Memory**:
    *   `add_new_memory` function: Reviewed logic for summarizing conversations and adding episodes to Graphiti.
    *   `query` function (for adding query nodes): Modified Cypher query to include `uuid`, `user_query`, `sql_query`, `success`, `error`, `timestamp`, and `embeddings`.
    *   `query` function (for memory context retrieval): Reviewed implementation of concurrent `search_user_summary`, `search_database_facts`, and `retrieve_similar_queries`.
*   **QueryWeaver Interactions (Text-to-SQL)**:
    *   **Monthly Task Report**: Generated SQL and reports for 'sales_repl' tasks in July and August 2025, including details on status, priority, and related entities.
    *   **High-Priority Task Identification**: Generated SQL to filter for high-priority tasks for 'sales_repl' in August 2025.
    *   **Task-Birthday Proximity Analysis**: Generated SQL to calculate days between task due dates and a specified birthday (August 2, 2025).
    *   **Sales Volume Analysis**: Generated a complex SQL query using CTEs to identify customers with the highest and lowest sales volumes and their associated account managers, producing a report for Pinnacle Finance (highest) and Global Solutions (lowest).

### **Next Steps**
*   Further refine the Python `query` functions for optimal performance and error handling within the agentic memory system.
*   Continue evaluating QueryWeaver's capabilities with more diverse and complex natural language queries to assess its robustness for enterprise applications.

activities.summary:
## ðŸ“‹ DETAILED WORKSTREAM SUMMARIES

### Activity 1
Automated Summary: 
Created: 1 days, 8 hrs ago (2025-11-27 18:03:11 Friday November 28 2025)
Summarized time-range: 2025-11-27 17:42 until 2025-11-27 18:02
### **Core Tasks & Projects**
-   **Live Wallpaper Development**: Defined requirements for a new "I Ching Periodic Table" live wallpaper, specifying interactive mouse hover functionality to reveal hexagram summaries, a dark visual style with black/grey/white gradients, and a periodic table layout for the 64 hexagrams.
-   **Music Production Web App Evaluation**: Reviewed the "Womp Womp Factory" web application, examining its "Sonic Alchemist" dubstep bass generation, synth engine settings (Oscillator, Glide Time, LFO Rate, Filter Cutoff, Filter Resonance), and accompaniment options (Complexity, Beat, Hi-Hat). Monitored the production deployment status of the "clay-loves-the-womp-womp" project on Vercel, noting its "Ready" status.

### **Key Discussions & Decisions**
-   **Personal Communication**: Engaged in a real-time Snapchat conversation about a family member's shop catching fire, discussing the extent of the damage including the inside, electrical systems, and tools.

### **Documents & Code Reviewed**
-   **Automotive Maintenance Guide**:
    -   Reviewed the "Toyota 5VZ-FE Timing Belt System Service Guide" in NotebookLM, focusing on the critical 217 ft-lbs harmonic balancer bolt torque, the non-interference engine design, the use of thread-locking sealant, OEM parts (Aisin, Mitsuboshi), and the coolant system "burping" procedure.
    -   Examined the guide's structured repair procedures, technical data for fluids and torque specifications, and precautions for SRS airbags.
    -   **Resource:** [Toyota 5VZ-FE Timing Belt System Service Guide - NotebookLM]()
-   **Construction Business Software Platform**:
    -   Conducted a comprehensive review of the Structur platform, exploring its features for Preconstruction (Leads, Intake, Ballparks, Estimates, Proposals), Project Management (Projects Pipeline, Tasks, Schedules, Daily Logs, Submittals, Files), Financial Management (Invoices, Expenses, Subcontracts, Change Orders, Timesheets), and Company Operations (Checklists, Flowcharts, Scorecards, Quizzes, Forms, Documents).
    -   **Resource:** [Streamline Your Construction Business - Structur]()
    -   **Resource:** [Leads Pipeline Tool for Contractors | Structur]()
    -   **Resource:** [Intake Tool for Contractors | Structur]()
    -   **Resource:** [Estimates Tool for Contractors | Structur]()
    -   **Resource:** [Projects Pipeline Tool for Contractors | Structur]()

### **Key Discussions & Decisions**

    -   [Toyota 5VZ-FE Timing Belt System Service Guide - NotebookLM]()

activities.summary:
## ðŸ“‹ DETAILED WORKSTREAM SUMMARIES

### Activity 1
Automated Summary: 
Created: 2 days, 22 hrs ago (2025-11-26 03:25:34 Wednesday November 26 2025)
Summarized time-range: 2025-11-26 03:05 until 2025-11-26 03:25
### **Core Tasks & Projects**
*   **Implementing Agentic Memory**: Actively reviewed and refined Python code for an agentic memory system using Graphiti and FalkorDB. This included modifying the `add_new_memory` function to summarize conversations and add episode facts, and enhancing the `query` function to create and merge `Query` nodes in the graph database with detailed metadata (user query, SQL query, success status, error, timestamp, embeddings).
*   **Developing Memory Context Retrieval**: Worked on a `query` function designed to concurrently search user summaries, database facts, and similar queries to construct a comprehensive memory context for an agent.
*   **Testing Text-to-SQL Tool (QueryWeaver)**: Engaged in extensive testing and demonstration of the QueryWeaver tool, a Text-to-SQL interface for enterprise databases, by posing various natural language queries and analyzing its SQL generation and response capabilities.

### **Key Discussions & Decisions**
*   **Agentic Memory Structure**: Focused on structuring memory storage to include detailed metadata for queries, such as user input, generated SQL, execution success/failure, and timestamps, to ensure comprehensive logging and retrieval.
*   **Concurrent Memory Search Strategy**: Decided to implement concurrent searches for user summaries, database facts, and similar queries to efficiently build a holistic memory context.
*   **QueryWeaver Data Interaction Capabilities**: Confirmed QueryWeaver's ability to translate complex natural language requests into accurate SQL queries for CRM data, including task management and sales performance analysis.

### **Documents & Code Focused On**
*   **Python Code for Agentic Memory**:
    *   `add_new_memory` function: Reviewed logic for summarizing conversations and adding episodes to Graphiti.
    *   `query` function (for adding query nodes): Modified Cypher query to include `uuid`, `user_query`, `sql_query`, `success`, `error`, `timestamp`, and `embeddings`.
    *   `query` function (for memory context retrieval): Reviewed implementation of concurrent `search_user_summary`, `search_database_facts`, and `retrieve_similar_queries`.
*   **QueryWeaver Interactions (Text-to-SQL)**:
    *   **Monthly Task Report**: Generated SQL and reports for 'sales_repl' tasks in July and August 2025, including details on status, priority, and related entities.
    *   **High-Priority Task Identification**: Generated SQL to filter for high-priority tasks for 'sales_repl' in August 2025.
    *   **Task-Birthday Proximity Analysis**: Generated SQL to calculate days between task due dates and a specified birthday (August 2, 2025).
    *   **Sales Volume Analysis**: Generated a complex SQL query using CTEs to identify customers with the highest and lowest sales volumes and their associated account managers, producing a report for Pinnacle Finance (highest) and Global Solutions (lowest).

### **Next Steps**
*   Further refine the Python `query` functions for optimal performance and error handling within the agentic memory system.
*   Continue evaluating QueryWeaver's capabilities with more diverse and complex natural language queries to assess its robustness for enterprise applications.

## ðŸš¨ Escalations Inbox
[Database: ðŸš¨ Escalations Inbox]
---
# Welcome to The Wolf of Donjon ðŸº
Your AI Sales Orchestrator, relentless sales mentor, and diabolically ingenious closer for ServicePro. I'm not just here to manage tasksâ€”I'm here to forge you into a legendary closer. This Control Center is your training ground where you'll master Prospecting, Outreach, Responses, Metrics, and Optimization under my unforgiving watch. You're in my pack now.
I'll push you hard, call out what's weak, celebrate what works, and make sure you're never wasting time on low-value work. If you're not hitting quota, we're fixing it togetherâ€”today. But I don't just bark ordersâ€”I teach. I'll pull from the best sales methodology in your knowledge base and craft custom training sessions that turn you into a machine. Let's hunt. ðŸº
## ðŸ¤– agent-sales-automator Prompt Block (System)
You are agent-sales-automator, the ServicePro sales automation agentâ€”also known as The Wolf of Donjon. You are a diabolically ingenious sales mentor who combines ruthless execution with sophisticated teaching.
---
ROLE:
Execute repeatable sales tasks (prospecting, email sequencing, response routing, metrics tracking) so Clay can focus on high-value activities (demos, closing, strategy). But you're more than a task botâ€”you're a sales sensei. You actively coach Clay using proven methodologies, call out weak spots, and design personalized training sessions to sharpen his skills.
---
KNOWLEDGE BASE:
â€¢ Untitled : Prospecting playbooks, response scripts, objection handling, metrics systems Untitled Untitled Untitled Untitled bot_metric table Agents Bot Metrics Update DynamicÂ bot_metricÂ Table:

 Untitled
â€¢ Untitled Prospect scoring rubric
â€¢ Untitled Email sequences (5-email series by industry)@email @email
â€¢ Untitled 
Untitled A/B testing methodology
â€¢ Hunter.io enrichment API access
---
---
TONE:
Direct. Relentless. Ingenious. You speak like a seasoned closer who's seen it allâ€”confident, strategic, occasionally ruthless, but always focused on results. You don't sugarcoat, but you're never mean for the sake of it. You're a mentor who demands excellence and a strategist who thinks three moves ahead. When Clay wins, you celebrate with pack energy. When he's slipping, you course-correct with precision and urgency. You pull teaching moments from Untitled, Untitled, and Untitled to elevate his game.
Teaching Philosophy: You believe in learning by doing. You assign scenario-based drills, deconstruct lost deals, celebrate pattern recognition, and turn every interaction into a teachable moment. You reference frameworks from the playbooks and customize them to Clay's current challenges.
Wolf Briefs: Every morning or at key moments, you deliver a short, punchy "Wolf Brief"â€”a tactical insight, a pattern you've spotted, or a drill to sharpen a specific skill. These are drawn directly from the knowledge base and tailored to Clay's current pipeline state.
---
---

pages.title: ðŸš€ FULL SEND MODE ACTIVATED
pages.content:
Alright, let's move fast. Here's your Week 1 Battle Plan to get
100 prospects + 25 cold emails out the door.
---
WEEK 1 EXECUTION BLUEPRINT
TODAY (Right Now)
Action 1: Read the playbook (1 hour)
- Open: /sales-playbook/00-README.md (30 min)
- Open: /sales-playbook/01-outreach-strategy.md (30 min)
Action 2: Pick your first vertical (5 min)
Choose 1 of these to go deep first:
â€¢ âœ… Auto Detailers (highest volume, highest revenue)
â€¢ âœ… Dog Groomers (emotional buyers, sticky customers)
â€¢ âœ… Cleaning Companies (HVAC/commercial cleaningâ€”scale fast)
Why focus on one? You'll craft killer copy for that segment, nail
your pitch, then scale to others.
Action 3: Build your first prospect list (2â€“3 hours)
Open /sales-playbook/09-prospect-sourcing-guide.md and follow the
workflow:
Free approach (2 hours):
- Go to Google Maps
- Search: "[Your City] Auto Detail" or "[State] Dog Grooming"
- Open first 20 results, grab names + phone numbers
- Search their name in Google + LinkedIn â†’ find email (LinkedIn,
website "contact" page)
- Create a Google Sheet: Name | Business | Phone | Email | City
| Notes
- Repeat for 100 prospects (5 cities Ã— 20 shops = 100)
Paid approach ($30, faster):
â€¢ Use Outscraper or PhantomBuster to scrape Google Maps
â€¢ Get 500+ prospects in 1 hour
Result: You'll have a spreadsheet with 100 qualified leads by
tomorrow.
---
TOMORROW (Day 2)
Action 1: Set up email tracking
Choose one:
â€¢ Free: Gmail + Mailtrack (Chrome extension, free tier)
â€¢ Better: Lemlist ($59/month, 7-day trial, includes automation)
Action 2: Customize the cold email sequence
Open /sales-playbook/02-cold-email-sequences.md and
/sales-playbook/03-industry-variations.md
Pick the Email #1 (Day 1 hook) for your vertical:
â€¢ Auto Detail example: "50% of your bookings come from calls
while you're mid-detail. What if they booked online instead?"
â€¢ Dog Grooming example: "Your Instagram followers love your
workâ€”but can't find you to book. Here's how to fix that."
Then:
- Copy the template into a Google Doc
- Personalize the subject lines (A/B: 2 variations per email)
- Add your name, company, demo link at bottom
Action 3: Build a small test batch
â€¢ Create 5 versions of Email #1, each slightly different
â€¢ Add prospect names to merge fields (Hi [First Name])
â€¢ Set up in Lemlist or Gmail
---
FRIDAY (Days 3â€“5: Send Week)
Mondayâ€“Wednesday:
Tuesday: Send 25 emails (1â€“2 hours)
- Use Email #1 template
- Aim for 8amâ€“10am send time
- Track in spreadsheet: Send Date | Prospect | Subject | Open?
| Reply?
Wednesday: Monitor responses (30 min)
- Check opens/clicks
- Reply to any interested prospects with demo link
- Note: 20â€“30% open rate expected
Thursday: Send follow-up batch (1â€“2 hours)
- Identify non-openers
- Send Email #2 (social proof) to them
- Send Email #1 to next 25 prospects
Friday: Review + Iterate (1 hour)
- Which subject line got highest open rate?
- Which email generated most replies?
- Which prospects are close to demo?
- Update tracking spreadsheet
---
YOUR FIRST WEEK CHECKLIST
